title: Alcaraz Overcomes Challenges in First Post-Australian Open Victory
summary: Carlos Alcaraz secured a hard-fought victory in his first match since winning the Australian Open, defeating Arthur Rinderknech 6-4, 7-6 (7-5) in the first round of the Qatar Open in Doha. The match presented significant challenges, particularly in the second set where Alcaraz saved two set points before clinching the tie-break. Alcaraz acknowledged the difficulty, describing Rinderknech as a dangerous opponent and expressing satisfaction with his performance under pressure. This win extends Alcaraz's perfect start to the 2026 season to 8-0 and marks his 150th tour-level victory on hard courts. He now advances to face Valentin Royer in the second round. The article also highlights fitness issues in the Dubai Tennis Championships, where several players, including Mirra Andreeva and Belinda Bencic, advanced due to opponent withdrawals, reflecting ongoing concerns about player health in the sport. Additionally, the WTA announced the formation of a council to improve the women's game, indicating broader organizational efforts.
